name: Easy Rumaki with Pineapple
author: Barbara
summary: This combines the crunchiness of bacon and water chestnuts with the wonderful flavors of pineapple. We make it right before watching football games, but it doesn't last long.
ingredients: 8  thick-cut bacon slices, cut crosswise into 3 pieces
½ cup low-fat sesame-ginger salad dressing
1 tablespoon chopped green onion, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Line the bottom section of a broiler pan with aluminum foil, top with the broiler rack, and spray rack with cooking spray
Place a water chestnut slice atop each pineapple cube; wrap each with 1 bacon slice, securing with a toothpick
Arrange wrapped pineapple on the prepared broiler rack
Bake in the preheated oven for 7 minutes; turn and continue baking until bacon is almost crisp, about 8 more minutes
Brush rumaki with sesame-ginger dressing and continue baking until bacon is crisp, about 5 more minutes
